data.process: Drop-in on Wednesday, counselling and support also available by appointment - call or email for more information
data.services: Support, advice and guidance. Weekly wellbeing classes also available.

data.process: Welfare advice, ESOL and Older Women's Group require appointments (email or phone). Domestic violence support is accessible via drop-in.
data.day: MON/TUE (Welfare Advice): Appointment only. TUE and THU (ESOL): 10am - 12pm. THU: (Domestic Violence support, drop-in): 9.30am - 5pm, THU: Older Women's Social Group:  10am -2pm.
data.services: Support services for Asian women. Staff speak Bengali, English, Hindi and Urdu.

data.process: Tuesday: Drop In 10.30 - 15.30, Wednesday Drop In - 10:00 - 16:00. Call or email to book appointments outside of these times.
data.telephone: 020 7739 2950/ 07805 061908 (to book for appointments Monday or Thursday)
data.day: Mon - Fri (for specific class/ advice times see website)

data.process: For appointments, Tues/Thu 10am -12pm, call or email. For drop-ins, see Column1

data.process: All the bikes are provided during the lesson and donated after the end of the course. To refer/book a place contact Claire: 07410114140, claire@thebikeproject.co.uk

data.process: Call the Advice line free on 0808 801 0660 or email us atadvice@wgn.org.uk
data.services: Counselling, sexual violence helpline, advice service, young women's advocacy service (YWAP), workshops, ISVA (Independent Sexual Violence Advocate) service, therapeutic groupwork, body therapies

data.process: Call or email advice@solacewomensaid.org for information
data.clients: Women and girls over 13 who have experienced sexual violence
data.day: Monday 10am-2pm, Tuesday 10am-1pm and 6-8pm, Wednesday and Thursday 1-5pm, Friday 10-2pm

Largest provider of accommodation and outreach support in London and assist female, male and transgender survivors of trafficking ranging from the exploitation of the prostitution of others or other forms of sexual exploitation, forced labour or services, domestic servitude, slavery or practices similar to slavery servitude to the removal of organs. 5 safe houses and expanded community outreach service.
Empowering women through providing good quality homes, and support to women who have experienced domestic violence, trafficking and mothers leaving prison.

data.clients: Victims of gender-based violence (please see the column services for more details)
data.services: Support services for those who are experiencing gender based violence (domestic violence, rape and sexual assault, stalking, prostitution, sexual exploitation, trafficking for sexual exploitation, FGM, forced marriage, "honour"-based violence)
